repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Currently in my own config, I pass the new function handler into `buf_request_sync`, however the linter complains so I've to silence it with `---@diagnostic disable-next-line: param-type-mismatch`.

While this isn't a big deal, `buf_request_sync` can accept the function, so the docs/linter may as well know about it.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
                      Parameters to send to the server. If a function, it is passed the LSP client and the buffer number and should return the respective parameters.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -789,7 +789,10 @@ buf_request_sync({bufnr}, {method}, {params}, {timeout_ms})
     Parameters: ~
       • {bufnr}       (`integer`) Buffer handle, or 0 for current.
       • {method}      (`string`) LSP method name
-      • {params}      (`table?`) Parameters to send to the server
+      • {params}      (`table|(fun(client: vim.lsp.Client, bufnr: integer): table?)?`)
+                      Parameters to send to the server. Can also be passed as
+                      a function that returns the params table for cases where
+                      parameters are specific to the client.

comment_data.body:
Will reword to this now @MariaSolOs .

Just to point out, this docstring was a direct copy/paste of `buf_request_all`'s `params` arg [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/5f9f5bc04d0bec0fbf100dd5a0de2b38daf882fb/runtime/lua/vim/lsp.lua#L1196-L1198), should I reword that too to be consistent?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -789,7 +789,10 @@ buf_request_sync({bufnr}, {method}, {params}, {timeout_ms})
     Parameters: ~
       • {bufnr}       (`integer`) Buffer handle, or 0 for current.
       • {method}      (`string`) LSP method name
-      • {params}      (`table?`) Parameters to send to the server
+      • {params}      (`table|(fun(client: vim.lsp.Client, bufnr: integer): table?)?`)
+                      Parameters to send to the server. Can also be passed as
+                      a function that returns the params table for cases where
+                      parameters are specific to the client.

comment_data.body:
Ohh I see. I think that my suggested description is more helpful and we should indeed try to keep both consistent, but this is a biased opinion.

WDYT @lewis6991?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -789,7 +789,10 @@ buf_request_sync({bufnr}, {method}, {params}, {timeout_ms})
     Parameters: ~
       • {bufnr}       (`integer`) Buffer handle, or 0 for current.
       • {method}      (`string`) LSP method name
-      • {params}      (`table?`) Parameters to send to the server
+      • {params}      (`table|(fun(client: vim.lsp.Client, bufnr: integer): table?)?`)
+                      Parameters to send to the server. Can also be passed as
+                      a function that returns the params table for cases where
+                      parameters are specific to the client.

comment_data.body:
Personally it doesn't seem necessary to redescribe the type annotation in English. It's clear what arguments the function accepts. This is unlike eval.txt which doesn't have type annotations, so descriptions of the arguments are necessary.

I don't mind either way though, but I'd lean on the side of being concise.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -789,7 +789,10 @@ buf_request_sync({bufnr}, {method}, {params}, {timeout_ms})
     Parameters: ~
       • {bufnr}       (`integer`) Buffer handle, or 0 for current.
       • {method}      (`string`) LSP method name
-      • {params}      (`table?`) Parameters to send to the server
+      • {params}      (`table|(fun(client: vim.lsp.Client, bufnr: integer): table?)?`)
+                      Parameters to send to the server. Can also be passed as
+                      a function that returns the params table for cases where
+                      parameters are specific to the client.

comment_data.body: Agreed. I kind of feel like the entire 2nd sentence isn't needed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -789,7 +789,10 @@ buf_request_sync({bufnr}, {method}, {params}, {timeout_ms})
     Parameters: ~
       • {bufnr}       (`integer`) Buffer handle, or 0 for current.
       • {method}      (`string`) LSP method name
-      • {params}      (`table?`) Parameters to send to the server
+      • {params}      (`table|(fun(client: vim.lsp.Client, bufnr: integer): table?)?`)
+                      Parameters to send to the server. Can also be passed as
+                      a function that returns the params table for cases where
+                      parameters are specific to the client.

comment_data.body: OK so, remove everything after "Parameters to send to the server" then?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -789,7 +789,10 @@ buf_request_sync({bufnr}, {method}, {params}, {timeout_ms})
     Parameters: ~
       • {bufnr}       (`integer`) Buffer handle, or 0 for current.
       • {method}      (`string`) LSP method name
-      • {params}      (`table?`) Parameters to send to the server
+      • {params}      (`table|(fun(client: vim.lsp.Client, bufnr: integer): table?)?`)
+                      Parameters to send to the server. Can also be passed as
+                      a function that returns the params table for cases where
+                      parameters are specific to the client.

comment_data.body:
I'm not sure if it's obvious enough that the function should return the request parameters as the return type is only `table`. I'm also not sure it's obvious that when it is passed as a function that the function itself is not the parameters, but the return of the function.

If you guys think it is then no worries.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -789,7 +789,10 @@ buf_request_sync({bufnr}, {method}, {params}, {timeout_ms})
     Parameters: ~
       • {bufnr}       (`integer`) Buffer handle, or 0 for current.
       • {method}      (`string`) LSP method name
-      • {params}      (`table?`) Parameters to send to the server
+      • {params}      (`table|(fun(client: vim.lsp.Client, bufnr: integer): table?)?`)
+                      Parameters to send to the server. Can also be passed as
+                      a function that returns the params table for cases where
+                      parameters are specific to the client.

comment_data.body:
I personally think it is. But okay I made this PR more complicated than it should be lol.

@tigh-latte I think that using the same description as `buf_request_all` is fine (so what you originally had).
comment_data.diff_hunk:

comment_data.body: Ha that's fine I'll move back to what was there originally

comment_regular_data.body:
@MariaSolOs that failing FreeBSD test looks to be unrelated but I'm not sure. Is it flaky or have I tripped over something?

I'm certain is passed earlier when I opened this PR originally, but I can't find the run to double check

> @MariaSolOs that failing FreeBSD test looks to be unrelated but I'm not sure. Is it flaky or have I tripped over something?
> 
> I'm certain is passed earlier when I opened this PR originally, but I can't find the run to double check

Yeah don’t worry, it’s just a flaky test.

title: docs(lsp): `vim.api.buf_request_sync` can also take function as `params`
